definition: private room (in a restaurant, or for karaoke etc)/parlor/booth/compartment
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: A pudgy hostess leads us to a dimly lit private room without windows.
sentences.chinese: 一個矮墩墩的女服務員領我們到了一個昏暗的包間。

sentences.english: Bai Cong with snow day soldiers came to the restaurant on the second floor, walked into the room, shut the door.
sentences.chinese: 白叢雪帶着日兵來到茶樓二樓，走進包間，關上門。

sentences.english: A man walks up to the bar and asks for an entendre.
sentences.chinese: 一個男子走到酒吧，要一個包間。

sentences.english: HanShan trot into agreed pack, suddenly was stuck.
sentences.chinese: 韓珊快步走進商定的包間，猛然愣住。

sentences.english: Walking through the splendid hall, we entered No. 2 Private Room.
sentences.chinese: 穿過富麗堂皇的大堂，我們進入了二號包間。

definition: box (in a theater or concert hall)/private room (in a restaurant or karaoke)
standard (hotel) room/two-person room of standard size and amenities/abbr. to 标间
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
variant of 裝潢|装潢[zhuang1 huang2]
soft sleeper (a type of sleeper train ticket class with a softer bunk)
